alert.note: Alert for Knox; Marion; Morrow; Richland (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 02 at 8:17PM EDT by NWS Cleveland
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of south central Richland, Marion, Morrow and Knox Counties through 900 PM EDT... At 817 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Marion to near Sunbury to near Baltimore. Movement was northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Marion, Mount Vernon, Mount Gilead, Fredericktown, Gambier, Utica, Cardington, Centerburg, Ashley, Prospect, Danville, Waldo, Chesterville, Sparta, Waterford, Caledonia, Edison, Green Camp, Marengo and Fulton. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
